intro: Eriogonum setaceum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes, where it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually reduced to scales or bracts, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum setaceum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing food for native wildlife.
